description.narrative: Vulnerable and emergency-affected people have access to safe drinking water, which contributes to Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Vulnerable and emergency-affected people have access to safe drinking water

description.narrative: The challenges in the water sector remain critical on the humanitarian, recovery and development front. Poor maintenance of the limited facilities and fragmented weak government institutions are increasing the gaps and inequities in access to safe water. 496,574 men, women, boys and girls have been provided with access to safe water through water trucking, drilling and rehabilitation of boreholes and the operation and maintenance of water yards and surface water treatment systems. In collaboration with WASH cluster partners, residents of the Protection of Civilian sites and Internally Displaced Persons sites continue to access safe water based on Sphere standards. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
